intro: Lagochilum mucronatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to rocky or arid environments.
